metadata.synopsis: A team composed of an aerospace scientist (Warner Anderson), an ex-Air Force general (Tom Powers) and an industrialist (John Archer) conceive an ambitious plan to land Americans on the moon. From their base in the Mojave Desert, they construct and successfully launch a spacecraft named "Luna" that contains a cargo of four astronauts. But a critical miscalculation of needed power to escape the moon's gravitational pull may put the astronauts' lives in danger.

reviews: Destination Moon is good hocus-pocus stuff about interplanetary travel.
Jules Verne by way of Robert A. Heinlein, the staid harbinger of the Space Race
Heinlein's original novel had Nazis on the moon!
Taken as sort of a pre-pre-pre-historic Apollo 13, I suspect the die-hard sci-fi fans might enjoy this one.
A abordagem cientfica adotada pelo roteiro contrabalana a trama rasa e o patriotismo barato do filme.
High on American patriotism of the let's beat the Russians to the moon kind.
Dull now, but a landmark at the time.
One of the early s-f adventures, now dated, but still interesting to watch.
